alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Chester; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 27 at 12:19AM EDT until March 27 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CHESTER...SOUTHWESTERN YORK AND SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 1219 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles southwest of York, or 6 miles south of Sharon, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Lockhart, Sharon, Hickory Grove, Mcconnells, Lowrys, Saratt and Bullock Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
